dev
Class DeviceMulticastUpdater

java.lang.Object
  dev.DeviceUpdater
      dev.DeviceMulticastUpdater
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class DeviceMulticastUpdater
extends DeviceUpdater

Extended DeviceUpdater to support multicast device discovery. Depending on the client, it may or may not do the client-server discovery. Depending on the IP address of the name server it may or may not do multicast device discovery.

Author:
Mamta

Constructor Detail

DeviceMulticastUpdater

public DeviceMulticastUpdater(Device ns,
                              Device local)
Construct a new multicast updater. If invokes the base class constructor which will create the client-server updater if needed. If the name server IP address is multicast address, it will also create the multicast socket and join the multicast group. The multicast socket is set with TTL of 1 so that it does not go beyond local network.

Parameters:
ns -
local -
Method Detail

close

public void close()
The client application calls close, to terminate this thread.

run

public void run()
The thread function has four parts: 1. for client-server case, add local device to the name server. 2. for client-server case, get list of current online devices from name server. 3. remove any expired devices from our list. 4. for multicast case, advertise our device information if available. 5. for multicast case, receive device information from other devices.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class DeviceUpdater

multicastLocalDevice

protected void multicastLocalDevice()
Multicast the local device information to the group. The expired attribute is added so that other devices can remove this information if we don't send a refresh.

clearDevices

public void clearDevices()
Clear the list of devices. This is called by the client to clear the list before fetching a new list, so that it gets the most-up-to-date devices list.

multicastQuery

public void multicastQuery()
Send a multicast command, which triggers the other devices to respond immediately with their device information. This is used by the client to immediately get the devices list, instead of waiting for the next interval.

multicastReceive

protected void multicastReceive()
Receive a message on the multicast socket and act on it. If it is a request, then respond with local device information if available. If it is a message, then update our devices list.

receiveDeviceData

private void receiveDeviceData(Device newDevice)
Receive a new device data from another device, and update local devices list.

Parameters:
newDevice -
